What is the purpose of the OPTION_PBAAS flag on a Verus chain?
The OPTION_PBAAS flag, set to 256, indicates that the chain is a PBaaS (Public Blockchain as a Service) chain definition.

// clear is permissionless, if set, IDs may only be created by controlling ID OPTION_ID_STAKING = 4         // all IDs on chain stake equally, rather than value-based staking OPTION_ID_REFERRALS = 8        // if set, this chain supports referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What does the OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag do when set on a Verus chain?
When the OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag is set on a Verus chain, it means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices.

// clear is permissionless, if set, IDs may only be created by controlling ID OPTION_ID_STAKING = 4         // all IDs on chain stake equally, rather than value-based staking OPTION_ID_REFERRALS = 8        // if set, this chain supports referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What is the purpose of the OPTION_ID_STAKING flag in Verus?
The OPTION_ID_STAKING flag, set to 4, indicates that all IDs on the chain stake equally, rather than using value-based staking.

// clear is permissionless, if set, IDs may only be created by controlling ID OPTION_ID_STAKING = 4         // all IDs on chain stake equally, rather than value-based staking OPTION_ID_REFERRALS = 8        // if set, this chain supports referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What does the OPTION_ID_REFERRALS flag do when set on a Verus chain?
When the OPTION_ID_REFERRALS flag is set on a Verus chain, it means that the chain supports referrals.

// clear is permissionless, if set, IDs may only be created by controlling ID OPTION_ID_STAKING = 4         // all IDs on chain stake equally, rather than value-based staking OPTION_ID_REFERRALS = 8        // if set, this chain supports referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What is the difference between OPTION_ID_REFERRALS and OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED?
OPTION_ID_REFERRALS (set to 8) indicates that a Verus chain supports referrals, while OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED (set to 16) means that the chain requires referrals.

// clear is permissionless, if set, IDs may only be created by controlling ID OPTION_ID_STAKING = 4         // all IDs on chain stake equally, rather than value-based staking OPTION_ID_REFERRALS = 8        // if set, this chain supports referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What does the OPTION_TOKEN flag indicate when set on a Verus chain?
When the OPTION_TOKEN flag is set on a Verus chain, it indicates that the chain is a token, rather than a native currency.

// clear is permissionless, if set, IDs may only be created by controlling ID OPTION_ID_STAKING = 4         // all IDs on chain stake equally, rather than value-based staking OPTION_ID_REFERRALS = 8        // if set, this chain supports referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What is the purpose of the OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY flag on a Verus chain?
The OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY flag, set to 64, is used for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to a single currency.

// clear is permissionless, if set, IDs may only be created by controlling ID OPTION_ID_STAKING = 4         // all IDs on chain stake equally, rather than value-based staking OPTION_ID_REFERRALS = 8        // if set, this chain supports referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What is the purpose of the OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag on a Verus chain?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag, set to 1024, determines whether top-level ID and currency registration happen on the launch chain or not. When not set on a gateway, top-level ID and currency registration happen on the launch chain.

// clear is permissionless, if set, IDs may only be created by controlling ID OPTION_ID_STAKING = 4         // all IDs on chain stake equally, rather than value-based staking OPTION_ID_REFERRALS = 8        // if set, this chain supports referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What does the OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag indicate when set on a Verus chain?
The OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag, set to 2048, indicates that the token is a single satoshi NFT token, which tokenizes control over the root ID.

// clear is permissionless, if set, IDs may only be created by controlling ID OPTION_ID_STAKING = 4         // all IDs on chain stake equally, rather than value-based staking OPTION_ID_REFERRALS = 8        // if set, this chain supports referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What does the OPTION_GATEWAY flag indicate when set on a Verus chain?
When the OPTION_GATEWAY flag is set on a Verus chain, it means that the chain routes external currencies.

// clear is permissionless, if set, IDs may only be created by controlling ID OPTION_ID_STAKING = 4         // all IDs on chain stake equally, rather than value-based staking OPTION_ID_REFERRALS = 8        // if set, this chain supports referrals OPTION_ID_REFERRALREQUIRED = 16    // if set, this chain requires referrals OPTION_TOKEN = 32           // if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
